intro: Elephantopus virgatus, commonly known as the silverleaf elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces numerous stems that bear clusters of tiny flowers. Its botanical features make it an attractive and resilient plant for arid environments.
